name: Hits of Broadway Quiz | Plots of Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: A man is released from prison and is befriended by a kind bishop.
questions.explanation:
Les Miserables.

	Jean Valjean becomes the father of a young girl, Cosette, whose mother, Fantine, has died.

questions.text: An opera house is haunted by a masked man.
questions.correct: The Phantom of the Opera & Phantom of the Opera & Phantom
questions.explanation:
The Phantom of the Opera & Phantom of the Opera & Phantom.

	Christine is lured to an underground lair where the phantom of the opera falls in love with her and she has to make a choice whether to stay with him or he will kill Raoul.

questions.text: After witnessing a murder, a tormented young boy becomes a master at pinball.
questions.explanation:
Tommy.

	Tommy sees his father killed by his mother's lover. He withdraws into himself and finds that the game of pinball brings him out of his tormented mind.

Jekyll and Hyde.

	A middle-aged man makes a potion that gives him a multiple personality which starts to take over his life.

questions.text: Felines get together to sing and talk.
questions.explanation:
Cats.

	'Cats' is simply a story about a group of felines that sing, talk and dance. The play ended on June 25, 2000 in the US.

questions.text: Two educated men hatch a plan to make more money.
questions.explanation:
The Producers.

	Two men, Max and Leo, put on the worst Broadway play ever and end up in prison together where they start a jail musical.

questions.text: Two girls become obsessed with a TV show.
questions.explanation:
Hairspray.

	The play takes place in 1962 in Baltimore.

questions.text: A lion cub grows to be a king.
questions.explanation:
The Lion King & Lion King.

	A lion cub named Simba grows up to be king with the help of a few of his friends.

questions.text: A man falls in love with a dying woman.
questions.explanation:
La Boheme.

	Rudolph meets the love of his life in a young girl named Mimi, but when they reunite Rudolph loses her to consumption.

questions.text: A young man searching for his true calling ends up living with a woman and her son.
questions.explanation:
Pippin.

	Now the lights have gone out on Broadway. Goodbye.
